data.text: Is There Specialist Insurance for Bike Touring People?
Is there specialist Insurance for Bike touring people? I presume most people get some sort of insurance when cycling abroad in case of accidents and bike theft? TIA.
Ok I'm interested to know what the answer is.

data.author: Chris Morfas

data.text: Contact Cycling UK (used to be CTC). They can either provide or suggest insurers. But you might want to weigh up the cost of the policy against the value of your bike, particularly if you're planning on camping. There will also be conditions, such as having a gold-rated lock (generally very heavy) etc.
data.author: Huw Thomas

data.text: Thank you. I'm more worried about expensive medical bills than the bike getting stolen.
data.author: Teddy Edwards

data.text: Well, medical insurance is completely different. You don't need cycling specific insurance for that. Most travel insurance will offer cover for sports. I'm not sure but I don't think it even generally costs that much. Winter sports like skiing carry high premiums but I don't think cycling is viewed as that dangerous.
data.author: Huw Thomas

data.text: Cycling UKs insurance is Yellow Jerseys. You can get cover just for the bike or bike and medical cover. Short trip or annual policies. They do cover a limited range of preexisting conditions but not mine so I went with Stay Sure for medical insurance. Stay Sure have a good reputation for dealing with medical conditions and do include touring as a covered activity provided you wear a helmet (ie if you had an accident not wearing one its down to you). As a member of Cycling UK you get a discount of 10% or 15% with Yellow Jerseys cannot recall which. And yes you must use a gold rated lock, but if you value your bike !!!.
